intro.description: This cheat sheet helps you to open an image, and shows you how to use the line profile tool with the file. If you have just completed the previous cheat sheet, please close all your data file parts.

item.title: DataVis Perspective
item.description: Please choose the DataVis perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Click to open an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image.

item.title: Select 'Line Profile' tool
item.description: Select the 'Line Profile' tool from the toolbar above the plot, tools labelled 'Image tools used to profile and inspect images'. These tools may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.

item.title: Add a line
item.description: Find a group of spots running in a line and click and drag your line profile through them. Note you can move your line after it is added by using the control points at either end or by translating it, again by clicking and dragging it.

item.title: View Profile
item.description: Look at the 'Line Profile' tool view on the right hand side of the image. Here you will see the intensity values of the spots which you have passed your line through.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations, you can now use line profiles with images. Try with your images and with multiple lines. NOTE: If you use the masking tool, you can mask out pixels with unwanted intensity values and this profile tool will use the mask.
